title: Wait. So are Darkin still the source of Blood Magic?
body:
If Darkin are supposed to be former Ascended of Shurima that were corrupted by the Void...

Does that mean Blood Magic is Void Magic now?

replies.body:
From the Great Darkin War page: _"Over the centuries, they mastered many forbidden forms of primal magic"_.

No, Blood magic is Blood magic and not related to Void magic.

Darkin were alien invaders and not related to anything in the world, including the Void.

Then came the lore update.

Now the Darkin are Ascended who's minds cracked when they became corrupted by the Void.

So how resolute are you really going to be in claiming that Blood Magic isn't Void magic now?
Very resolute, I'd assume. That quote seems pretty concrete.
Because Voidlings donâ€™t have any sort of blood magic to begin with while Varus tells that it has been a Darkin gift.

Yes, but Varus' lore last year also told us that the Darkin were invaders from another dimension. Now it tells us that they're fallen Ascended, less than a year later.

So there is no stability in how the lore is being handled. You can't say anything is absolute or concrete because they seem to change things on a whim.

But the part about blood magic hasn't changed and thus it's most likely they are keeping this.

If you bring up the Lore instability then there is no reason to consider the Void at all because it might be changed into bearheaded unicorns.

The part about the Darkin being trapped in weapons didn't chance in the 8 months the lore was around before the newest retcon.

All I'm saying is nothing is concrete anymore. The lore is changing much more rapidly, and they're far more willing it seems to erase and replace than build within the bounds.
